@graph.name: Homemade Meatball Recipe - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: The best homemade meatballs. Delicious & versatile, this meatball recipe is easy to make on the stovetop or baked in the oven.

@graph.name: How do you keep meatballs from falling apart?

acceptedAnswer.text: Cooking the meatballs using one of these two methods before adding them to your sauce of choice is the best way to ensure they do not fall apart. This way they are nice and browned and hold up very well when you add sauce to serve them!

@graph.name: Is it better to bake or fry meatballs?

acceptedAnswer.text: This is purely preference. I prefer to bake the meatballs because they all cook at once and it's less time consuming.

@graph.name: Why do you put milk in meatballs?
What can I use instead of milk in meatballs?

acceptedAnswer.text: I often substitute our favorite pasta sauce in place of milk with great results.

@graph.name: Best Homemade Meatballs Recipe
@graph.description: The best homemade meatballs. Easy to make and incredibly versatile, this meatball recipe will become a family favorite. Learn how to make meatballs either on the stovetop or baked in the oven to serve a variety of ways - over pasta, as an appetizer, etc.

video.name: Homemade Meatballs Recipe
video.description: The best homemade meatballs. Easy to make and incredibly versatile, this meatball recipe will become a family favorite. Learn how to make meatballs either on the stovetop or baked in the oven to serve a variety of ways - over pasta, as an appetizer, etc.

recipeIngredient: ½ cup whole milk (or pasta sauce)
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
½ cup breadcrumbs (or quick cooking oatmeal)
Optional: ¼ cup finely diced fresh basil or parsley

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl combine ground beef, egg, milk and Worcestershire sauce.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl combine ground beef, egg, milk and Worcestershire sauce.

itemListElement.text: Add breadcrumbs, parmesan, sea salt, pepper, garlic and onion and stir until evenly distributed.
itemListElement.name: Add breadcrumbs, parmesan, sea salt, pepper, garlic and onion and stir until evenly distributed.

itemListElement.text: Use a small cookie scoop or measuring spoon and measure out 1 TBS portions of the meatball mixture, then roll it with your hands.
itemListElement.name: Use a small cookie scoop or measuring spoon and measure out 1 TBS portions of the meatball mixture, then roll it with your hands.

itemListElement.text: Add 1-2 TBS olive oil to a nonstick fry pan and turn heat to medium.
itemListElement.name: Add 1-2 TBS olive oil to a nonstick fry pan and turn heat to medium.

itemListElement.text: Add half of the meatballs (12) and cover.
itemListElement.name: Add half of the meatballs (12) and cover.

itemListElement.text: Cook, covered, on one side for 4-5 minutes or until they are golden-brown.
itemListElement.name: Cook, covered, on one side for 4-5 minutes or until they are golden-brown.

itemListElement.text: Remove lid and flip the meatballs. Cook for another 4-5 minutes until meatballs are golden brown and the internal temperature is 160 degrees F.
itemListElement.name: Remove lid and flip the meatballs. Cook for another 4-5 minutes until meatballs are golden brown and the internal temperature is 160 degrees F.

itemListElement.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a large baking sheet, set aside.
itemListElement.name: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a large baking sheet, set aside.

itemListElement.text: Place meatballs on a greased baking sheet evenly spread out.
itemListElement.name: Place meatballs on a greased baking sheet evenly spread out.

itemListElement.text: Bake in preheated oven for 10-15 minutes. Meatballs should reach an internal temperature of 160 degrees F.
itemListElement.name: Bake in preheated oven for 10-15 minutes. Meatballs should reach an internal temperature of 160 degrees F.

itemListElement.text: Serve with pasta sauce, over noodles, etc.
itemListElement.name: Serve with pasta sauce, over noodles, etc.
